title: How to Make a Halter from an Old Shirt (No Sewing)

steps.headline: Find a T-shirt.
steps.description: Pick an old T-shirt. Look for one that has no designs on it. Plain ones work better.

steps.headline: Cut into tube.
steps.description: Cut across the T-shirt.Start from the bottom of under one sleeve. Drawing a line with tailors chalk first would help You should have a type of tube.

steps.headline: Flip the shirt.
steps.description: The hem of the T-shirt should be at the top.

steps.headline: Cut on one side of the shirt, measure down a couple of inches, and cut a sloping line down the back.
On the other side of the shirt, measure 8 inches (20.3 cm) in the center, and cut the excess in corners.
Wear it on and tie around your neck.
steps.description: Then find a place to wear it to!

text: Find a T-shirt. Pick an old T-shirt. Look for one that has no designs on it. Plain ones work better. Cut into tube. Cut across the T-shirt.Start from the bottom of under one sleeve. Drawing a line with tailors chalk first would help You should have a type of tube. Flip the shirt. The hem of the T-shirt should be at the top. Cut on one side of the shirt, measure down a couple of inches, and cut a sloping line down the back.  On the other side of the shirt, measure 8 inches (20.3 cm) in the center, and cut the excess in corners.  Thread a string through them.  Wear it on and tie around your neck. Then find a place to wear it to!
